tool.name: pal_finder
tool.description: Find microsatellite repeat elements sequencing reads and design PCR primers to amplify them

param.name: primer_prefix
param.label: Primer prefix
param.help: This prefix will be added to the beginning of all primer names

param.name: min_2mer_repeats
param.label: Minimum number of 2-mer repeat units to detect
param.help: Set to zero to ignore repeats of this n-mer unit

param.name: min_3mer_repeats
param.label: Minimum number of 3-mer repeat units
param.help: Set to zero to ignore repeats of this n-mer unit

param.name: min_4mer_repeats
param.label: Minimum number of 4-mer repeat units
param.help: Set to zero to ignore repeats of this n-mer unit

param.name: min_5mer_repeats
param.label: Minimum number of 5-mer repeat units
param.help: Set to zero to ignore repeats of this n-mer unit

param.name: min_6mer_repeats
param.label: Minimum number of 6-mer repeat units
param.help: Set to zero to ignore repeats of this n-mer unit

param.name: keep_config_file
param.label: Output the config file to the history

param.name: primer_options
param.label: Primer settings to use
param.help: Advanced users can customise the settings for primer3 for more control

param.name: primer_min_tm
param.label: Minimum acceptable melting temperature for a primer oligo (PRIMER_MIN_TM)
param.help: Temperature should be in degrees Celsius

data.name: output_pal_summary
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string} for ${primer_prefix} (microsatellites with read IDs and primer pairs)

tool.help:
**What it does**
pal_finder finds microsatellite repeat elements directly from raw 454 or Illumina paired-end sequencing reads. It then designs PCR primers to amplify these repeat loci (Potentially Amplifiable Loci: PAL).
This tool is compatible with pal_finder version 0.02.04; pal_finder can be obtained from http://sourceforge.net/projects/palfinder/
